page.title: 19SCENERY AROUND CONSETT
page.content: The areas natural cover consists of deciduous woodland,river bank,natural pasture and wasteland.Woodland trees,predominantly deciduous,include guelder rose,wild cherry,blackthorn and bird cherry.Smaller trees and bushes,holly,broom,rhododendron and gorse are found in woods or hedgerows while elderberries,crab-apples and blackberries provide autumn fruit. Older trees and leaf litter provide habitats for varied fungi.Wild garlic, bluebells,wood sorrel and wood anemones carpet open woodlands with primroses,blue and white violets,dogs mercury,foxgloves and bugle.The lighter wood edges support,water avens,herb bennet,cow wheat,crosswort and borage.Birds include blue,great, long tailed and coal tits,gold finches,bull finches,tree creepers, redwing,owls,kingfishes,herons,dippers
